title: "expected open delimiter" error after upgrading nightly
body:
Just updated to the latest nightly, and tried to compile my project that depends on the `wayland-client` crate (via `glutin`), and am now getting the following error:

```
error: expected open delimiter
    --> /home/ichi/git/tonari/portal/target/debug/build/wayland-client-70bfa2c113fdda5f/out/wayland_c_api.rs:3039:24
     |
3039 |     bitflags! bitflags ! { # [ doc = "drag and drop actions

This is a bitmask of the available/preferred actions in a
drag-and-drop operation.

In the compositor, the selected action is a result of matching the
actions offered by the source and destination sides.  "action" events
with a "none" action will be sent to both source and destination if
there is no match. All further checks will effectively happen on
(source actions \u{2229} destination actions).

In addition, compositors may also pick different actions in
reaction to key modifiers being pressed. One common design that
is used in major toolkits (and the behavior recommended for
compositors) is:

- If no modifiers are pressed, the first match (in bit order)
will be used.
- Pressing Shift selects "move", if enabled in the mask.
- Pressing Control selects "copy", if enabled in the mask.

Behavior beyond that is considered implementation-dependent.
Compositors may for example bind other modifiers (like Alt/Meta)
or drags initiated with other buttons than BTN_LEFT to specific
actions (e.g. "ask")." ] pub struct DndAction : u32 { # [ doc = "no action" ] const None = 0 ; # [ doc = "copy action" ] const Copy = 1 ; # [ doc = "move action" ] const Move = 2 ; # [ doc = "ask action" ] const Ask = 4 ; } }
     |                        ^ expected open delimiter

error: aborting due to previous error

error: Could not compile `wayland-client`.
```

Rust:
```
rustc 1.35.0-nightly (cb2f34dc6 2019-03-22)
```
